thread.title: VOTE: EFL Goals of the Month
thread.title_full: VOTE: EFL Goals of the Month

title: VOTE: EFL Goals of the Month

organizations.name: efl head of marketing communications andy dodd

text:
VOTE: Sky Bet EFL Goals of the Month for February in the Championship, League One and League Two Last Updated: 10/03/17 6:22am Have your say on the best Sky Bet EFL Goal of the Month for February Watch and vote for the best Sky Bet EFL Goals of the Month for February in the Championship, League One and League Two. 
The three leagues continue to produce some stunning strikes as we hurtle towards the end of the season with fights for promotion, play-offs and relegation in full swing. 
But which goal was the best? Watch the videos of the three nominated strikes from each league and vote for your favourite. Voting closes at 6pm on Tuesday, March 14. Championship Here's the nominees for the Sky Bet Championship Goal of the Month award for February 2017 
Almen Abdi (Nottm Forest 1-2 SHEF WED - February 18) 
Sprinting forward to join the attack, Abdi watched the ball drop to him on the edge of the area to strike a sweet volley that flew past Forest keeper Jordan Smith. 
Jonny Howson (NORWICH 5-1 Nottm Forest - February 11) 
When a corner was headed out, Howson cleverly judged the ball's looping trajectory to send a technically perfect volley into the top corner off the outside of his right foot. 
Michael Kightly (BURTON 2-1 Norwich - February 18) 
Two impeccable touches saw Kightly cushion a dropping through ball past Norwich defender Russell Martin before chipping keeper John Ruddy with a first-time half-volley. League One Here's the nominees for the Sky Bet League One Goal of the Month award for February 2017 
Rob Hall (Swindon 1-2 OXFORD - February 5) 
Goals in derbies are always memorable. Hall's was even more special as he danced past two defenders before unleashing an unstoppable dipper into the roof of the net. 
Erhin Oztumer (Bolton 4-1 WALSALL - February 11) 
The 'Turkish Messi' lived up to his nickname with this one. Spotting Bolton 'keeper Ben Alnwick off his line, he whipped home an impudent 40-yard looping volley. 
Andrew Tutte (Chesterfield 1-2 BURY - February 18) 
Picking the ball up in midfield, Tutte only had one thing in his mind - a 30-yard piledriver into the corner that Chesterfield keeper Thorsten Stuckmann could only watch. League Two Here's the nominees for the Sky Bet League Two Goal of the Month award for February 2017 
Paul Mullin (Leyton Orient 0-1 MORECAMBE - February 7) 
There seemed no danger when Mullin collected a bouncing ball with three defenders around him. That was until his sweet turn and deliciously curling 25-yard shot. 
Josh Payne (Wycombe 1-2 CRAWLEY - February 25) 
It was not just the accuracy of Payne's stunning 30-yard free-kick into the top corner which left fans gasping, but the arrowhead speed at which it flew over the wall. 
Gary Roberts (Carlisle 0-3 PORTSMOUTH - February 25) 
Collecting a Michael Doyle pass, Roberts rode challenges as he set himself to brilliantly flick home a shot off the outside of his left boot in the vital promotion clash. 
The shortlist for the poll is decided by a judging panel following suggestions from supporters via Twitter. 
The judging panel comprises Sky Sports' EFL expert Don Goodman; Sky Bet Sponsorship Manager David Tweed and EFL Head of Marketing Communications Andy Dodd. 
To suggest a goal to be considered for future Sky Bet Goal of the Month awards, fans can tweet details of their nominated goal to @SkyBet using #SkyBetGotM. Also See:
